qas.question: Which format is considered to look most realistic, LaserDisc or DVD?
Which format, LaserDisc or DVD, is said to appear sharper and clearer to most viewers?
What features do LaserDiscs lack in, causing DVDs to appear sharper and clearer?

context: Similar to the CD versus LP sound quality debates common in the audiophile community, some videophiles argue that <a0_0>LaserDisc<a0_0/> maintains a "smoother", more "film-like", natural image while DVD still looks slightly more artificial. Early DVD demo discs often had compression or encoding problems, lending additional support to such claims at the time. However, the <a2_0>video signal-to-noise ratio and bandwidth<a2_0/> of LaserDisc are substantially less than that of DVDs, making <a1_0>DVDs<a1_0/> appear sharper and clearer to most viewers.
